text: I don't know um if it was there uh that
I uh decided uh that even if I was going
to
die and obviously I
didn't I'm not AFA afraid of death uh
death is part of life
most people I have met uh particularly
Americans uh just are so afraid of
death um I don't look forward to it at
85 I know it's just a few years away but
I don't fear it I believe in the
afterlife I believe in reward and
Punishment and I hope I'll be
rewarded
um I think some of all of that comes
from having served
in the
war
um and I think um serving in a war and
seeing people
die
um also impacts on how you think about
other Wars so I believe uh that this
country has to be defended and there are
just Wars and certainly World War I was
uh such a just War uh but that the
Vietnam War was not and I thought that
we shouldn't be in it and I was marched
in various demonstrations uh against it
uh I
uh believed it was uh wrong and
ultimately um a huge majority of the
people of this country thought it was
wrong and uh they stopped it with their
marches well I think like most soldiers
at the time um I served in the European
theater of operations and served in two
campaigns one for northern France the
other for the reinland and I fought u in
Holland Belgium
Germany um I saw people
killed I was very frightened and often
thought I would uh probably die
uh in Europe on the battlefield
somewhere but I didn't and uh I came out
alive I uh was discharged as a
sergeant um I think that being in a war
has an effect on your character your
outlook on life and uh I don't recommend
it there certainly other
ways to build
character um but it's part of uh who you
are what you are
